BY MICHAEL LEV / STAFF WRITER

BILL ALKOFER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER Related article » For the second time in three seasons, USC has fired its football coach after just five games.

âAfter careful consideration of what is in the best interest of the university and our student-athletes, I have made the decision to terminate Steve Sarkisian, effective immediately,â Haden said in a statement.
âThrough all of this, we remain concerned for Steve and hope that it will give him the opportunity to focus on his personal well being.â

However, Sarkisian appeared to be off during a team meeting Sunday morning, the squadâs first time back together since losing to Washington on Thursday. Sarkisian did not attend practice that afternoon as school officials, including Haden, scrambled to figure out what was happening and how to handle it.
Haden said it was âvery clearâ after talking with Sarkisian on the phone that he was ânot healthy.â After Haden announced later Sunday that Sarkisian would go on leave, reports surfaced detailing heavy alcohol use during his time as the coach at UW. Sarkisian, who has three children, also is going through a divorce.
